body_text:
Hello lovely humans,
css-loader just published its new version 0.25.0.

  
    
      State
    
    
      Update 🚀
    
  
  
    
      Dependency
    
    
      css-loader
    
  
  
    
      New version
    
    
      0.25.0
    
  
  
    
      Type
    
    
      devDependency
    
  

This version is not covered by your current version range.
Without accepting this pull request your project will work just like it did before. There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though.
I recommend you look into these changes and try to get onto the latest version of css-loader.
Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update.
Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right?
Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work?
There is a collection of frequently asked questions and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. Let them know.
Good luck with your project ✨
You rock!
🌴

The new version differs by 3 commits .

22f6621 0.25.0
5a9c1d1 Merge pull request #324 from markdalgleish/prefix-hashes-with-underscores-based-on-css-spec
da27c07 Prefix hashes with underscores based on CSS spec

See the full diff.

This pull request was created by greenkeeper.io.
Tired of seeing this sponsor message? ⚡️ greenkeeper upgrade

title: Update css-loader to version 0.25.0 🚀
body:
Hello lovely humans, [css-loader](https://www.npmjs.com/package/css-loader) just published its new version 0.25.0.
State Update :rocket:
Dependency css-loader
New version 0.25.0
Type devDependency
This version is **not covered** by your **current version range**. Without accepting this pull request your project will work just like it did before. There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though. I recommend you look into these changes and try to get onto the latest version of css-loader. Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update. Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right? Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work? There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html) and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. [Let them know](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new). Good luck with your project :sparkles: You rock! :palm_tree: --- The new version differs by 3 commits . - [`22f6621`](https://github.com/webpack/css-loader/commit/22f6621a175e858bb604f5ea19f9860982305f16) 0.25.0 - [`5a9c1d1`](https://github.com/webpack/css-loader/commit/5a9c1d13940194b78bff0e27284836557f962e5b) Merge pull request #324 from markdalgleish/prefix-hashes-with-underscores-based-on-css-spec - [`da27c07`](https://github.com/webpack/css-loader/commit/da27c07d0df25a38699344c13b6614c53a469fd9) Prefix hashes with underscores based on CSS spec See the [full diff](https://github.com/webpack/css-loader/compare/278d6cce09aba7d1364b051e03733e510560eabb...22f6621a175e858bb604f5ea19f9860982305f16). --- This pull request was created by [greenkeeper.io](https://greenkeeper.io/). Tired of seeing this sponsor message? :zap: `greenkeeper upgrade`
